intro: Hieracium fallax, commonly known as the autumn hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often have a reddish hue. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn, producing yellow disk flowers surrounded by white to pink ray florets. Hieracium fallax is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
